lessons.content:
In this experience we will build a robust yet simple login system with a fully functional error-safe login and sign up screen. The app we build is a great starting point for any application which needs the user to login, and have access to the user information within the application.

The database we will be using is Firebase and it will be built with state management in mind, using Riverpod.

Learn with interactive and highly visual step by step lessons to guide you through the complete process of not just building the app, but understanding how to think like an expert developer.
lessons.headline: Ultimate Login System
lessons.subheadline: Learn to build the ultimate login system with Riverpod and Firebase

lessons.content:
Next, we will add an `OutlinedButton` at the bottom, and you will notice the next problem we will face. In the `onPressed` argument, we need to retrieve the value of the email and password, so we can pass it over to Firebase. But how do we do that?

> Notice that the editor gives an error that the button can't be `const`. That's because the whole Scaffold is `const`. This requires you to move the `const` lower in the widget tree to each `TextField`.
lessons.heading: Add Button

lessons.content:
### Congratulations

**That's it!** You have now created a fully functional login system using Flutter. 

If you enjoyed this course, I would really appreciate it if you shared it with your friends or even just told them about [hungrimind.com](https://www.hungrimind.com). But in general, thank you so much, and I hope to see you in the next course.
lessons.heading: Congratulations
